decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, utilizing efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast for direct damage. Thraben Inspector and Novice Inspector provide card advantage and Makeshift Munitions can turn creatures into additional damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of creatures and burn spells, while also having some removal options like Journey to Nowhere and Demand Answers to control the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and counterspells to maintain board control and disrupt opponent's strategy. By consistently deploying flyers like Spellstutter Sprite and Judge's Familiar, alongside efficient removal spells like Snap and Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to pressure opponents while protecting its own threats. With a variety of card draw options like Of One Mind and Ninja of the Deep Hours, the Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countering spells, protecting key creatures with protection spells, and recurring threats through card draw and fetch spells. The deck aims to establish a strong defense using gates and the Guardian of the Guildpact, while also maintaining card advantage with Deep Analysis and Squadron Hawk. The overall strategy is to outlast opponents and grind them down with incremental advantages until victory is achieved. The deck excels in long, grindy games where patience and resource management are key.

The primary focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. By using cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Simian Spirit Guide to generate extra mana and play multiple threats in a single turn, along with powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrade, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can establish a defense. The inclusion of cards like Trailblazer's Torch and Crimson Fleet Commodore provide additional reach and finishing power to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize reanimation spells and combo pieces to quickly get powerful creatures onto the battlefield. By using cards like Exhume, Dread Return, and Deadly Dispute, the player can bring back creatures like Avenging Hunter and Troll of Khazad-dûm from the graveyard for extra value. The deck also includes removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down to control the board while setting up their combo. The inclusion of cards like Thorn of the Black Rose and Crypt Rats provides additional utility and options for the player to outmaneuver their opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing walls with high toughness to generate mana and combo off with cards like Freed from the Real and Galvanic Alchemist. The goal is to ramp up quickly with Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement, while filtering through the deck with cards like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede to find the combo pieces. By creating a loop where you can untap your creatures repeatedly, you can generate infinite mana and win the game. The walls also provide protection and stall against aggressive decks until you can assemble your combo.
